segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to another great lesson here with EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到EnglishPod的另一堂精彩课程。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we're bringing you an upper intermediate lesson.
segments.cn: 今天我们为你带来一节中高级课程。

segments.en: A special lesson about the new president.
segments.cn: 一节关于新总统的特别课程。

segments.en: Right, it's been a hot topic in the US.
segments.cn: 对，这在美国是个热门话题。

segments.en: The new president-elect, President Obama.
segments.cn: 新当选的总统，奥巴马总统。

segments.en: Yes.
So today we're bringing you something that you might see at his inaugural address.
segments.cn: 所以今天我们带来一些你可能会在他就职演说中看到的内容。

segments.en: That's true.
So Marco, can you explain this word, inaugural address?
segments.cn: Marco，你能解释一下这个词，就职演说吗？

segments.en: The inaugural address is the first speech the president gives at the ceremony when he is officially president.
segments.cn: 就职演说是总统在正式成为总统时在仪式上发表的第一篇演讲。

segments.en: Okay, all right.
So it's his first presidential speech.
segments.cn: 所以这是他第一次总统演讲。

segments.en: Exactly.
Mm-hmm.
Great, so let's take a look at some other words that we're gonna find in the dialogue today in Vocabulary Preview.
segments.cn: 很好，那么让我们看看今天对话中会出现的一些其他单词，在词汇预览中。

segments.en: Vocabulary Preview.
All right, on Vocabulary Preview today we have two words.
segments.cn: 好的，今天的词汇预览中我们有两个单词。

segments.en: The first one is swear in.
Swear in.
Swear in.
Swear in.
We'll see this word in its past tense in the dialogue, right?
segments.cn: 我们将在对话中看到这个词的过去式，对吧？

segments.en: Sworn in.
Sworn in.
So it means... So to swear someone in is to officially give that person a very important position, usually in government.
segments.cn: 所以它的意思是……宣誓就职是正式给予某人一个非常重要的职位，通常是在政府中。

segments.en: Yeah, yeah.
And our second word is oath.
segments.cn: 我们的第二个词是誓言。

segments.en: Oath.
Oath.
O-A-T-H.
Oath.
An oath goes hand in hand with swear in, right?
segments.cn: 誓言与宣誓就职是密切相关的，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
When you swear someone in, they make an oath.
segments.cn: 当你宣誓就职时，他们会做出誓言。

segments.en: A promise, right?
A promise.
An official promise to carry out the duties of that job.
segments.cn: 一个正式的承诺来履行该工作的职责。

segments.en: Right, so they promise that they will do their job.
segments.cn: 对，所以他们承诺会做好他们的工作。

segments.en: Okay, great.
So now let's listen to our dialogue for a first time.
segments.cn: 现在让我们第一次听听我们的对话。

segments.en: Where are we?
Well, we're actually watching a news reporter on TV.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们实际上是在看电视上的新闻记者。

segments.en: She's in Washington and she's gonna tell us all about what's happening.
segments.cn: 她在华盛顿，她将告诉我们发生了什么。

segments.en: Great, so let's listen.
This is Madeline Wright for BCC News reporting live from Washington, D.C.
segments.cn: 这里是Madeline Wright，来自BCC新闻，正在华盛顿D.C.进行现场直播。

segments.en: where very shortly the new president will deliver his inaugural address.
segments.cn: 新总统即将发表他的就职演说。

segments.en: Just moments ago, the president was sworn into office following the United States Constitution.
segments.cn: 刚刚，总统根据美国宪法宣誓就职。

segments.en: The president sought an oath to faithfully execute the office of the presidency.
segments.cn: 总统宣誓忠实执行总统职务。

segments.en: And what exactly is going on now, Madeline?
Well, Tom, true to American tradition, the band has just played Hail to the Chief and the president has been honored with a 21-gun salute.
segments.cn: 嗯，Tom，遵循美国传统，乐队刚刚演奏了《致首领的敬礼》，总统受到了21响礼炮的荣誉。

segments.en: Now we're waiting for the president to take the stage and deliver his speech.
segments.cn: 现在我们在等待总统上台发表演讲。

segments.en: Tom, it's like the who's who of the political world here on Capitol Hill, with dignitaries representing several different countries.
segments.cn: Tom，这里就像国会山的政治界名流，来自几个不同国家的贵宾。

segments.en: What's the mood on the ground like, Madeline?
In a word, the mood here is electric.
The excitement in the air is palpable.
segments.cn: 空气中的兴奋是显而易见的。

segments.en: I've never seen a larger crowd here on Capitol Hill.
segments.cn: 我从未见过国会山上有如此庞大的观众。

segments.en: The audience is shouting, crying and embracing each other.
segments.cn: 观众在欢呼、哭泣和相拥。

segments.en: On this, a most historic day, you can feel the hope and the excitement in the air.
segments.cn: 在这个历史性的日子里，你能感受到空气中的希望和兴奋。

segments.en: The 20th of January will go down in history as the... Oh, Tom, it looks like the president is about to begin.
segments.cn: 1月20日将载入史册……哦，Tom，看起来总统要开始了。

segments.en: My fellow Americans,
I stand before you today...
Okay, some technical problems at the inaugural address.
segments.cn: 好的，就职演说中出现了一些技术问题。

segments.en: Yeah, I certainly hope this doesn't happen.
segments.cn: 是的，我真希望这不会发生。

segments.en: Well, if it does, you heard it first at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 如果发生了，你们在EnglishPod上第一次听到。

segments.en: Predictors of the future here.
Okay, let's take a look at language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看语言要点。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
On language takeaway today, we're bringing you four words.
segments.cn: 今天的语言要点中，我们带来了四个单词。

segments.en: The first word is deliver.
Deliver.
Deliver.
Like deliver a pizza.
No, let's listen.
We've got three examples that will show the meaning of this word.
segments.cn: 我们有三个例子来展示这个词的意思。

segments.en: Example one.
Who's going to deliver the welcome speech?
Example two.
I've been asked to deliver a presentation on the findings of our research project.
segments.cn: 我被要求发表关于我们研究项目发现的演讲。

segments.en: Example three.
Dr. Rosen is delivering a lecture on macroeconomics.
segments.cn: 罗斯博士正在发表关于宏观经济学的讲座。

segments.en: Okay,
so deliver a speech.
Say a speech.
To say a speech.
Yeah.
So you wouldn't say say a speech, you would say deliver a speech.
segments.cn: 所以你不会说说演讲，你会说发表演讲。

segments.en: Exactly.
Okay, our second word for language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好的，我们的第二个语言要点。

segments.en: The who's who.
The who's who.
The who's who.
This is a funny expression, hey?
segments.cn: 这是个有趣的表达，对吧？

segments.en: It's kind of weird.
The who's who is the important people in a particular field, right?
segments.cn: 名流是某一领域的重要人物，对吧？

segments.en: Right, so for example, there was a party last night and the who's who of the film industry was there.
segments.cn: 对，所以例如，昨晚有个派对，电影行业的名流都在场。

segments.en: Whoa, so all the important stars and directors.
segments.cn: 哇，所以所有重要的明星和导演。

segments.en: You could also say the funeral was like a who's who of the political world.
segments.cn: 你也可以说葬礼就像是政治界的名流聚会。

segments.en: Okay, so all the important political figures were at this funeral.
segments.cn: 好的，所以所有重要的政治人物都在这个葬礼上。

segments.en: Exactly.
Let's move to our third word.
segments.cn: 让我们进入第三个单词。

segments.en: Dignitaries.
Dignitaries.
Dignitaries.
Dignitaries.
Okay, we have some great examples so you can understand what this word means, so let's listen.
segments.cn: 好的，我们有一些很好的例子，以便你理解这个词的意思，所以让我们听听。

segments.en: Example one.
Several important dignitaries were present at the opening ceremony, including the president of Brazil, the king of Spain, and the pope.
segments.cn: 在开幕式上，几位重要的贵宾出席，包括巴西总统、西班牙国王和教皇。

segments.en: Example two.
There are going to be a lot of foreign dignitaries at the dinner.
segments.cn: 晚宴上将有很多外国贵宾。

segments.en: So basically we can understand that dignitaries are really important people, right?
segments.cn: 所以基本上我们可以理解贵宾是非常重要的人，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
Important political or religious figures.
segments.cn: 重要的政治或宗教人物。

segments.en: I see.
Alright, now our last word for language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在是我们最后一个语言学习的单词。

segments.en: Palpable.
Palpable.
Palpable.
Palpable.
When something is palpable it's so strong you can feel it.
segments.cn: 当某事是明显的，它是如此强烈以至于你能感受到它。

segments.en: Okay, so it's a very strong feeling.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这是一种非常强烈的感觉。

segments.en: You can almost touch it.
Yeah, like the excitement was palpable or the fear was palpable.
segments.cn: 是的，比如兴奋是明显的，或者恐惧是明显的。

segments.en: Okay, interesting word.
Palpable.
Let's listen to our dialogue again and now let's try and listen to all these words we just talked about.
segments.cn: 让我们再听一遍我们的对话，现在让我们尝试听听我们刚才谈到的所有这些词。

segments.en: This is Madeline Wright for BCC News reporting live from Washington, D.C.
segments.cn: 这里是麦德琳·赖特，来自BCC新闻，现场报道华盛顿特区。

segments.en: where very shortly the new president will deliver his inaugural address.
segments.cn: 不久之后，新总统将发表就职演说。

segments.en: Just moments ago the president was sworn into office following the United States Constitution.
segments.cn: 刚刚，总统根据美国宪法宣誓就职。

segments.en: The president sought an oath to faithfully execute the office of the presidency.
segments.cn: 总统宣誓忠实执行总统职务。

segments.en: And what exactly is going on now, Madeline?
segments.cn: 现在到底发生了什么，麦德琳？

segments.en: Well, Tom, true to American tradition, the band has just played Hail to the Chief and the president has been honored with a 21-gun salute.
segments.cn: 嗯，汤姆，忠于美国传统，乐队刚刚演奏了《致首领》，总统受到了21响礼炮的致敬。

segments.en: Now we're waiting for the president to take the stage and deliver his speech.
segments.cn: 现在我们在等待总统上台发表演讲。

segments.en: Tom, it's like the who's who of the political world here on Capitol Hill, with dignitaries representing several different countries.
segments.cn: 汤姆，这里就像政治界的名人聚集地，贵宾代表着几个不同的国家。

segments.en: What's the mood on the ground like, Madeline?
segments.cn: 现场的气氛如何，麦德琳？

segments.en: In a word, the mood here is electric.
The excitement in the air is palpable.
segments.cn: 空气中的兴奋是明显的。

segments.en: I've never seen a larger crowd here on Capitol Hill.
segments.cn: 我从未见过华盛顿特区国会山上有如此庞大的观众。

segments.en: The audience is shouting, crying and embracing each other.
segments.cn: 观众在欢呼、哭泣和相拥。

segments.en: On this, a most historic day, you can feel the hope and the excitement in the air.
segments.cn: 在这个历史性的日子里，你能感受到空气中的希望和兴奋。

segments.en: The 20th of January will go down in history as the...
Oh, Tom, it looks like the president is about to begin.
segments.cn: 哦，汤姆，看起来总统要开始了。

segments.en: My fellow Americans,
I stand before you today.
Okay, so if you noticed in our dialogue, we have some really interesting phrases there.
segments.cn: 好的，如果你注意到我们的对话中，有一些非常有趣的短语。

segments.en: Yes.
So I think it's time for us to take a look at Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 所以我认为是时候看看流利表达构建器了。

segments.en: On Fluency Builder today we're going to be looking at three phrases that are very interesting because we can change them a little bit and form different patterns.
segments.cn: 在流利表达构建器中，今天我们将看三个非常有趣的短语，因为我们可以稍微改变它们，形成不同的模式。

segments.en: Yeah, so the first phrase we have is in a word.
segments.cn: 是的，所以第一个短语是“一句话”。

segments.en: In a word.
In a word.
In a word.
We use this expression when we want to describe something in one word.
segments.cn: 我们使用这个表达来描述某事的一句话。

segments.en: Right.
Pretty simple, hey?
It's really simple.
Let's look at the pattern.
We've got examples of how you could use this phrase.
segments.cn: 我们有一些例子，展示如何使用这个短语。

segments.en: Example one.
In a word, the situation is serious.
Example two.
What's it like there?
In a word, it's amazing.
Okay, so in a word, this podcast is... Awesome.
segments.cn: 好的，所以一句话，这个播客是... 太棒了。

segments.en: Amazing.
Uh -huh.
Okay.
Okay, let's look at our second phrase today.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看今天的第二个短语。

segments.en: Go down in history.
Go down in history.
Go down in history.
So this is a really common phrase.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常常见的短语。

segments.en: I'm sure you guys have heard it.
Yeah, basically something that is really important that everyone will remember for a very long time.
segments.cn: 是的，基本上是指某件非常重要的事情，大家会记住很长时间。

segments.en: Let's look at this pattern with a few examples.
segments.cn: 让我们看看这个模式的一些例子。

segments.en: This is going to go down in history as the worst disaster the world has ever seen.
segments.cn: 这将载入史册，成为世界上最严重的灾难。

segments.en: Example two.
He'll go down in history as the best president we've ever had.
segments.cn: 他将载入史册，成为我们有史以来最好的总统。

segments.en: Example three.
This day will go down in history.
Okay, so as you can see, the pattern is we're using a superlative.
segments.cn: 好的，正如你所看到的，模式是我们使用了一个最高级。

segments.en: That's right, the most, the best.
The biggest.
The worst.
The worst, right?
And our final phrase in putting it together is...
So obviously you can change this one up a little bit, hey?
segments.cn: 所以显然你可以稍微改变这个，对吧？

segments.en: Right, you can say my fellow co-workers.
segments.cn: 对，你可以说我的同事们。

segments.en: Uh -huh.
My fellow citizens.
My fellow family members.
Yes.
So basically fellow just means like deer.
segments.cn: 所以基本上同胞只是意味着像...

segments.en: Yeah.
In some way.
Well, similar.
Similar.
Yeah.
So we looked at some great vocabulary and phrases.
segments.cn: 所以我们看了一些很棒的词汇和短语。

segments.en: And now let's talk a little bit about these American traditions when electing a new president.
segments.cn: 现在我们来谈谈美国在选举新总统时的一些传统。

segments.en: Yes.
Today in the studio we have JP who's joining us.
segments.cn: 今天在工作室里有JP和我们一起。

segments.en: Hi everyone.
Hey JP.
And he's going to be talking to us about these traditions.
segments.cn: 他将和我们谈谈这些传统。

segments.en: Oh, I am, okay.
What are we going to talk about?
21 gun salute, what's that all about?
The 21 gun salute is the military salute where they say, and now we will have the 21 gun salute.
segments.cn: 21响礼炮是军队的致敬，他们会说，现在我们将进行21响礼炮。

segments.en: So 21 soldiers with their rifles, they go, and they all shoot them off at the same time.
segments.cn: 所以21名士兵拿着步枪，他们一起开火。

segments.en: And I don't know why.
I think it's a sign of respect, hey?
segments.cn: 我认为这是尊重的标志，对吧？

segments.en: Weird respect though.
Well, I think in Europe they would do a Cannon or something.
segments.cn: 嗯，我认为在欧洲他们会用大炮或其他东西。

segments.en: One Cannon salute?
No, well just cannons.
Maybe just one Cannon.
Maybe our European listeners know the answer to this.
segments.cn: 也许我们的欧洲听众知道答案。

segments.en: Okay, and what about this song Hail to the Chief?
segments.cn: 好的，那这首《致首领的敬礼》呢？

segments.en: Do you know anything about that?
I do not know anything about it.
Except that it's a march, and I think it's Sousa.
segments.cn: 除了它是一首进行曲，我认为是苏萨写的。

segments.en: I think John Philip Sousa wrote it.
segments.cn: 我认为约翰·菲利普·苏萨写的。

segments.en: And whenever the president walks into a room, they play that song.
segments.cn: 每当总统走进一个房间时，他们会播放这首歌。

segments.en: Really?
Yes, and I played it once for President Bush, the first one.
segments.cn: 是的，我曾为布什总统演奏过这首歌，第一任。

segments.en: I was a drummer.
You did?
And my marching band had to play that song for him.
segments.cn: 我的军乐队必须为他演奏这首歌。

segments.en: Oh my God, JP, you're like famous.
Yeah, this was back in like 1986 or something.
segments.cn: 是的，这大约是在1986年左右。

segments.en: Was that even an election year?
Well, you did play for the president, so... That's pretty cool.
segments.cn: 嗯，你确实为总统演奏过，所以……这很酷。

segments.en: Yeah, yeah.
So JP, do you have any other sort of traditional things that happen when the president becomes the president?
segments.cn: 所以JP，你还有其他传统的事情吗，当总统成为总统时？

segments.en: Well, I can tell you that Jimmy Carter, when he was elected president, his motorcade was going down Pennsylvania Avenue, and he stopped the car and got out.
segments.cn: 嗯，我可以告诉你，吉米·卡特当选总统时，他的车队在宾夕法尼亚大道上行驶，他停下车下来了。

segments.en: Really?
To do what?
Yeah, to walk.
He wanted to walk down Pennsylvania Avenue.
segments.cn: 他想走在宾夕法尼亚大道上。

segments.en: He wanted to walk down the street.
To be with the people?
Yeah, I think so.
And I think it made the Secret Service insane.
segments.cn: 我认为这让特勤局抓狂。

segments.en: Maybe the car smelled bad or something.
Maybe so.
I think that is my memory of it.
segments.cn: 我想这是我对它的记忆。

segments.en: I might be confusing with the West Wing, but I'm not sure.
segments.cn: 我可能和《白宫风云》搞混了，但我不确定。

segments.en: Too much TV.
Yeah, maybe.
When the president walks, it's a big deal.
segments.cn: 当总统走路时，这是个大事。

segments.en: So JP, do you do anything special for the inauguration ceremony?
segments.cn: 所以JP，你在就职仪式上会做什么特别的事情吗？

segments.en: I always take the day off to watch.
segments.cn: 我总是请假一天来观看。

segments.en: You do?
I love watching it.
I love the swearing-in ceremony, the ritual of it, the speech.
segments.cn: 我喜欢宣誓仪式，仪式感，演讲。

segments.en: All right, everyone, we're out of time.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，我们没时间了。

segments.en: I hope you enjoyed this political lesson.
segments.cn: 希望你们喜欢这次政治课。

segments.en: And I hope you have a happy Inauguration Day.
segments.cn: 希望你们有一个愉快的就职日。

segments.en: Happy Inauguration Day, everyone.
Yeah.
All right, great.
We're definitely going to take the day off to watch it with JP.
segments.cn: 我们肯定会请假一天和JP一起观看。

segments.en: And hopefully you guys can too.
Well, thanks for listening, everyone.
And until next time, goodbye.
